intro: Pterosiphon multivenius, commonly known as the multivenus pterosiphon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun for optimal growth.
